    • Method Detail

      • addUser

        public model.IUser addUser(java.lang.String userId,
                  java.lang.String username)
        Description copied from interface: model.IPhotoAdminModel
        This function attempts to add the user, if he/she doesn't already exist inside the database. Otherwise, it will return the user, if he/she already exists. If you'd like to check whether a user already has been made, use the userExists(String userId) method.
        Specified by:
        addUser in interface model.IPhotoAdminModel
        Parameters:
        userId - The id of the user you'd like to create.
        username - The full name of the user to be created.
        Returns:
        The user that has just been newly created or the user that already exists in the database.

      • getUser

        public model.IUser getUser(java.lang.String userId)
        Description copied from interface: model.IPhotoAdminModel
        This reads users from storage into memory. If the user does not exist, this should do nothing.
        Specified by:
        getUser in interface model.IPhotoAdminModel
        Parameters:
        userId - Identifier of the desired user.

      • writeUser

        public void writeUser(java.lang.String userId)
        Description copied from interface: model.IPhotoAdminModel
        This writes a user from memory into storage. If the user does not exist, this should do nothing.
        Specified by:
        writeUser in interface model.IPhotoAdminModel
        Parameters:
        userId - Identifier of the desired user.

      • deleteUser

        public void deleteUser(java.lang.String userId)
        Description copied from interface: model.IPhotoAdminModel
        This deletes a user in storage. If current user is in memory, this should delete the user from memory and from storage. If the user does not exist, this should do nothing.
        Specified by:
        deleteUser in interface model.IPhotoAdminModel
        Parameters:
        userId - Identifier of the desired user.
